app.errorInterceptorMessageDefault: We are experiencing server problems. Please try again later.

bearing.featureWip: This feature is currently in development
bearing.noMeasurements: There are no measurements for the selected daterange

centerLoad.description: This chart shows the live load at the individual rolling elements (interpolated based on the 'Load Sense Pin' sensor readings).
centerLoad.title: Bearing Load Distribution

conditionMeasuringEquipment.benefitEdge: Schaeffler software can process and enrich sensor data, to provide a wide range of services and applications.
conditionMeasuringEquipment.benefitEdm: Transparency about grounding system and electrical discharges in bearing. Turbine operator can apply direct changes to grounding system to minimize risk of electricity-induced bearing failures.
conditionMeasuringEquipment.benefitGrease: Optimized grease quantities and relubrication intervals, early detection of sealing failures, Lower maintenance and lubricant costs.
conditionMeasuringEquipment.benefitLoad: Detailled analysis of operating loads on wind turbine can be used for optimizing the turbine and bearing design as well as the turbine control strategy.
conditionMeasuringEquipment.functionalityEdge: The edge device configures sensors and receives data from them. Local data processing for live applications and data reduction takes place. Long term analysis and calculations are done in Schaeffler cloud. Data and processed results can be provided to customer devices via cloud interfaces and to local computers via Ethercat Automation Protocol (EAP). Internet connectivity must be given for full functionality.
conditionMeasuringEquipment.functionalityEdm: The EDM has two antennas, which are inserted in a hole in the housing as close as possible to the rolling bearing. These antennas measure electrical discharges locally in the bearing. This information is transferred by cable to the evaluation unit, which generates an analogue signal that enables a long term analysis of discharge events. A rising number of discharges can, for example, be a sign for decreasing quality of the installed grounding system.
conditionMeasuringEquipment.functionalityGrease: The grease sensor has a diameter of 5 mm and is inserted in a hole in the housing as close as possible to the rolling bearing. The sensor is positioned in the lubricant. This grease sensor optically measures the water content, turbidity, thermal and mechanical wear and the grease temperature directly in the bearing arrangement. This information is transferred by cable to the evaluation unit, which generates an analogue signal that gives the user rapid and simple information on the condition of the grease.
conditionMeasuringEquipment.functionalityLoad: Continuous measurement of local stresses with steel pins, that are pressed in the core material of the bearing´s outer ring through additional drill holes. Schaeffler Sensotect Technology is applied on these steel pins with lasered measurement structures, to provide a non aging and precise measurment tool. Calculation of bearing load with software based on Schaeffler´s simulation tools BearinX on local edge device and in the cloud.
conditionMeasuringEquipment.interfacesEdge: Sensors (CAN, digital, analogue 4-20mA), Schaeffler Cloud, customer data collecting device / control unit (EAP)
conditionMeasuringEquipment.measurementPointsEdm: Number of electric discharges between components of the main bearing.
conditionMeasuringEquipment.measurementPointsGrease: Grease Temperature, Grease Water Content, Grease Deterioration
conditionMeasuringEquipment.name: Name
conditionMeasuringEquipment.title: Equipment meta data

edmMonitor.description: This chart shows a histogram of the last 48h of EDM signals, which are grouped and counted according to their value range (e.g. class '0 - 10', '10 - 100'). The count of a given class is visualized by means of its color (e.g. 'dark blue' stands for a high count).
edmMonitor.title: EDM Monitor

grease.description: This chart shows the live status of the grease with regards to temparature, water content as well as deterioration.

shaft.description: This chart shows the live rotational speed of the bearing.
shaft.title: Rotor Speed

static-saftey-factor-monitor.description: This chart shows the live Bearinx performance indicator 'Static Safety Factor'.
static-saftey-factor-monitor.title: Static Safety Factor

loadAssessment.description: This chart shows the historic sensor values for the selected sensors (e.g. 'Center Load Fx') with regard to the selected date range (see 'Date Picker'). Sensor information can be exported by means of the 'Download' functionality. Furthermore, the selected date range can be further refined via the blue slider.
loadAssessment.title: Bearing Load Run Chart

loadDistribution.description: This chart shows the average loads on the rolling elements (interpolated based on 'Load Sense Pin' signals) for the selected date range (see 'Date Picker').
loadDistribution.title: Bearing Load Distribution

maintenanceAssessment.description: This chart shows the historic sensor values for the selected sensors (e.g. 'Grease Monitor') with regard to the selected date range (see 'Date Picker'). Sensor information can be exported by means of the 'Download' functionality. Furthermore, the selected date range can be further refined via the blue slider.

gcm-heatmap.description:
This chart shows a heat-map for the grease status (temperature, water content as well as deterioration) for the last 365 days.
  • A given day is colored as 'red' if at least one threshold (temperature, water content or deterioration) was exceeded its given critical threshold for that day.
  • A given day is colored as 'orange' if at least one threshold (temperature, water content or deterioration) was exceeded the given warning threshold (but no sensor exceeded the critical threshold) for that day.
  • A given day is colored as 'green' if no threshold (temperature, water content or deterioration) was exceeded for that day.
gcm-heatmap.title: Grease Status Overview

maintenanceAssessment.title: Maintenance Run Chart
